citations.narrative:
The facility continues to house singly an adult non-releasable Floridian manatee, Guacara, at their enclosure labeled 24K
pool.
The Center has been offered to long-term house another non-releasable Floridian manatee, named Cayo, presently at
Zoo Tampa. The facility's attending veterinarian maintains his professional opinion that "Guacara" should have the
companionship of a compatible animal of the same or biologically related species. Manatees are semi-social animals and
do better medically and psychologically when they are housed in pairs or groups. Marine mammals, whenever know to be
primarily social in the wild, must be housed in their primary enclosure with at least one compatible animal of the same or
biologically related species.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the attending veterinarian and four additional facility
representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Patricia Laracuente, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.109  Repeat
   
Separation. 
The facility continues to house singly an adult non-releasable Floridian manatee, Guacara, at their enclosure labeled 24K 
pool. 
 
The Center has been offered to long-term house another non-releasable Floridian manatee, named Cayo, presently at 
Zoo Tampa. The facility's attending veterinarian maintains his professional opinion that "Guacara" should have the 
companionship of a compatible animal of the same or biologically related species. Manatees are semi-social animals and 
do better medically and psychologically when they are housed in pairs or groups. Marine mammals, whenever know to be 
primarily social in the wild, must be housed in their primary enclosure with at least one compatible animal of the same or 
biologically related species. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the attending veterinarian and four additional facility 
representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Patricia Laracuente, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
